name: Joseph Craycraft
title: Partner
courtAdmissions: All State and Federal Courts in West Virginia
education: 1998 West Virginia University, School of Law, Morgantown, WV - J.D.
1995 West Virginia University, Morgantown, WV - B.A. Accounting
bio: Joseph Craycraft is a partner in the firm’s West Virginia office. He has dedicated over twenty years to representing individuals, small business, and Fortune 100 and 500 companies in a wide range of civil litigation—including personal injury, general liability, product liability, insurance coverage, mass tort, trucking litigation, subrogation, workers’ compensation, business and commercial litigation, and breach of contract.

Mr. Craycraft handles matters throughout West Virginia and Ohio and is admitted to all state and federal courts in West Virginia. He is a member of the West Virginia Bar Association, West Virginia Defense Trial, and the Counsel Defense Research Institute.

Mr. Craycraft earned a B.A. in Accounting from West Virginia University and a J.D. from the School of Law. He is a lifelong resident of West Virginia and currently lives in Wheeling with his family. Beyond his practice, Mr. Craycraft is committed to public service and supporting higher education, devoting a significant portion of his career to serving as a member and Chairman of the Board of Governors for West Virginia Northern Community College.
volunteerWork: Member and Chairman of the Board of Governors for West Virginia Northern Community College
